content:
Nick has been doing pushups and then measuring the size of his bicep afterwards.  His data are shown in the table below.  Suppose he uses the line $y = x + 245$ to model his bicep size as a function of pushups.

**In the table below, calculate the residual value for each point.  Then plot the residuals on the graph below.**  

****Would an exponential or quadratic model be a better fit for the data?****  [[☃ dropdown 1]]  

 | | | || ||
- | - | -
**Pushups** |$0$ | $10$| $20$ | $30$ | $40$|$50$
**Size of bicep (cm)** | $245$ | $265$| $275$ | $280$| $282$|$283$
**Residual value** | [[☃ input-number 1]] | [[☃ input-number 2]]|  [[☃ input-number 3]]| [[☃ input-number 4]]|[[☃ input-number 5]]|[[☃ input-number 6]] 
  

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
